premise: Haeckel was a flamboyant figure, who sometimes took great, non-scientific leaps from available evidence. For example, at the time when Darwin published On the Origin of Species by Means of Natural Selection (1859), Haeckel postulated that evidence of human evolution would be found in the Dutch East Indies (now Indonesia). At that time, no remains of human ancestors had yet been identified. He described these theoretical remains in great detail and even named the as-yet unfound species, Pithecanthropus alalus, and instructed his students such as Richard and Oskar Hertwig to go and find it.

This is reflected in and perhaps inferable from the English, but I don't think it's a very strong link.

text: 地球科學是一門「上通天文，下知地理」的學科，舉凡人們腳下所踩的土地，分秒所呼吸的空氣，和我們生活息息相關的海洋以及朝夕相處的星星、月亮、太陽、乃至整個宇宙，都是研究的對象。 科學家用各種理论來研究地球，例如，數學幫助計算彗星的運動軌跡、氣團的移動和地震的規模；物理學用來研究地球的重力場、星體間的引力作用、鋒面或洋流的移動；藉由化學知識，可以分析岩石的化學組成；而生物學的原理，則幫助了解化石所隱含的意義，更進而建立演化的架構。
premise: Earth sciences can include the study of geology, the lithosphere, and the large-scale structure of Earth's interior, as well as the atmosphere, hydrosphere, and biosphere. Typically, Earth scientists use tools from geology, chronology, physics, chemistry, geography, biology, and mathematics to build a quantitative understanding of how Earth works and evolves. For example, meteorologists study the weather and watch for dangerous storms. Hydrologists examine water and warn of floods. Seismologists study earthquakes and try to understand where they will strike. Geologists study rocks and help to locate useful minerals. Earth scientists often work in the field—perhaps climbing mountains, exploring the seabed, crawling through caves, or wading in swamps. They measure and collect samples (such as rocks or river water), then record their findings on charts and maps.

annotations.comment:
The Chinese passage describes earth sciences as a discipline of science in which "above, the heavens (astronomy) is understood, and below, [that knowledge is used] to understand geography." In other words, this expression appears to describe earth science's status as a discipline whose scope encompasses both the terrestrial and astronomical or cosmic domains. This is backed up by the English, albeit not very forcefully, by references to "the atmosphere" on the one hand (the Chinese also mentions "stars," the sun and other heavenly bodies--星星、月亮 (the moon)、太阳 (the sun), the universe (宇宙) etc.); and "rocks" and "minerals" on the other (in the English; the Chinese also mentions rocks and minerals). On the whole, the Chinese passage is much more outspoken about the astronomical/cosmic focus of earth sciences than is the English. 

The Chinese is not only somewhat hyperbolic in its description of the earth sciences; it is also more poetical (especially in the first sentence). The "inferable" references are really just that--inferable. For instance, "oceans" (海洋) are listed as a subject of study in earth sciences, but in the English, we just know that "the seabed" and "water" are germane to earth scientists' work. 

The Chinese expounds on the disciplines which the English passage asserts offer "tools" to earth scientists (geology, biology, mathematics, etc.), explaining how "tools" from each of the listed disciplines may be applied to earth sciences research.

text: 短尾貓被列在瀕臨絕種野生動植物國際貿易公約的附錄Ⅱ中，即牠們未有滅絕的危險，但對其的獵殺及賣買須要監察。 據1988年估計，美國短尾貓的數量介乎700,000至1,500,000，且每年有上升的趨勢。 世界自然保護聯盟將短尾貓列為暫無危險，可見牠們相對的廣泛分佈，但在墨西哥南部卻未有清晰的統計。
premise: It is listed in Appendix II of the Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species of Wild Fauna and Flora (CITES), which means it is not considered threatened with extinction, but that international trade must be closely monitored. The animal is regulated in all three of its range countries, and is found in a number of protected areas of the United States, its principal territory. Estimates from the US Fish and Wildlife Service placed bobcat numbers between 700,000 and 1,500,000 in the US in 1988, with increased range and population density suggesting even greater numbers in subsequent years; for these reasons, the U.S. has petitioned CITES to remove the cat from Appendix II. Populations in Canada and Mexico remain stable and healthy. It is listed as least concern on the IUCN Red List, noting it is relatively widespread and abundant, but information from southern Mexico is poor.

annotations.comment:
If an animal is endangered, it would make sense that the hunting/killing of that species--as well as the trade in that species--should be monitored and/or mitigated. So, I have marked "hunting and killing" (猎杀) as "inferable," although the English version does not refer explicitly to hunting and killing. 
每年 means "every year" or "annually." In the context of the growing number of bobcats, this might be inferred from the English (in which the trend is described in more moderate terms, "subsequent years," "suggesting," etc.); but it is definitely a different idea than that in the English. 
Whereas only the initials IUCN are given in the English, the Chinese appears to give the whole name of the organization (世界自然保护联盟). I am considering this information "inferable" on this basis. I also labelled as "inferable" the discrepancy between the English and Chinese regarding the status given to the bobcat by this organization: The Chinese says "temporarily not in jeopardy," and the English says "least concern on the...Red List."
There may be a semantic ambiguity in the final sentence. The English says "information from southern Mexico is poor," and the Chinese reflects a reading of "poor" information whereby "poor" means "unclear." But because the sentence begins by describing the level of "concern" given to the animal, the use of "poor" arguably suggests that data from southern Mexico shows troubling signs, perhaps indicating a drop in population. I have marked this ambiguity as "inferable," but it may be that I am reading it too closely.

牠們 highlighted as inferable because it means "they" and the English text only used it. Regarding "but information from southern Mexico is poor", Chinese version says "but in southern Mexico, there has not been clear statistics", which is again similar but lacking in nuances, and that accounts for my highlights in the last segment. The rest should be rather straightforward.

title: 短尾貓
translation3: Bobcats are listed in Appendix II of the Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species of Wild Fauna and Flora, which means they are not in danger of extinction, but their hunting and trade need to be monitored. It was estimated in 1988 that the number of bobcats in the United States ranged from 700,000 to 1,500,000, with the number increasing every year. The International Union for Conservation of Nature lists bobcats as not at risk for the time being, which shows that they are relatively widely distributed, but there are no clear statistics in southern Mexico.

text: 约公元前1350年，阿蒙霍特普四世出人意料地登上王位，开始一系列激进且无秩序的改革，威胁到新王国的稳定。 他改名阿肯納頓（字面意思为“阿顿的仆人”或“阿顿光辉的灵魂”），将以前不起眼的太阳神阿頓捧为最高的神，禁止对其他神的崇拜，打击僧侣集团的权势， 还将首都迁往新城埃赫塔顿（意为阿頓的视线，即今天的阿马尔那）。 后来的法老图坦卡門、伊特努特·阿伊、霍朗赫布迅速抹去阿蒙霍特普四世的所有记载，这段短暂的时期被称为阿马尔那时代。
premise: Around 1350BC, the stability of the New Kingdom was threatened when Amenhotep IV ascended the throne and instituted a series of radical and chaotic reforms. Changing his name to Akhenaten, he touted the previously obscure sun deity Aten as the supreme deity, suppressed the worship of most other deities, and moved the capital to the new city of Akhetaten (modern-day Amarna). He was devoted to his new religion and artistic style. After his death, the cult of the Aten was quickly abandoned and the traditional religious order restored. The subsequent pharaohs, Tutankhamun, Ay, and Horemheb, worked to erase all mention of Akhenaten's heresy, now known as the Amarna Period.

annotations.comment:
The Chinese passage indicates that Amenhotep IV's ascension and institution of "radical and chaotic reforms" "imperiled" (威胁到) the "stability of the New Kingdom." The use of the passive voice in the English makes this causal relationship a bit murky. 

The Chinese gives two glosses for Amenhotep IV's new name "Akhenaten."

The Chinese also mentions that Akhenaten "attacked the power of the 'clerical/priestly cabal'" (僧侣集团)

A gloss is also given for the name of the city Akhetaten. 

The "first name" of the pharaoh referred to in the English as "Ay" is given. (I could not avoid highlighting the part that says "Ay" (阿伊), but it should not be highlighted).

EN: "worked to erase all mention"; CN: "quickly expunged"--"quickly" (迅速) is not inferable. Rather than indicate that these pharaohs sought to expunge "all mention of Akhenaten's heresy," the Chinese suggests that they aimed to eliminate "all traces" or "records" (所有记载) of Akhenaten in general. 

The "Amarna Period" is described in the Chinese as "brief" (短暂).

title: 古埃及
translation3: Around 1350 BC, Amenhotep IV unexpectedly ascended to the throne and began a series of radical and disorderly reforms that threatened the stability of the new kingdom. He changed his name to Akhenaten (literally "Servant of Aten" or "Glorious Soul of Aten"), exalted the previously inconspicuous sun god Aten as the highest god, banned the worship of other gods, and attacked monks The power of the group also moved the capital to the new city of Ekhtaton (meaning Aten's sight, today's Amarna). Later pharaohs Tutankhamen, Itnut Ay, and Horamheb quickly erased all records of Amenhotep IV. This short period was called the Amarna era.

Overall, measles usually resolves after about three weeks.

During the evolution of the solar system, the orbits of comets are not dynamically stable, and they will eventually crash into the sun or planets, or be thrown out of the solar system by the perturbations of planets. premise: Aphids, adelgids, and phylloxerids are very closely related, and are all within the suborder Sternorrhyncha, the plant-sucking bugs. They are either placed in the insect superfamily Aphidoidea or into the superfamily Phylloxeroidea which contains the family Adelgidae and the family Phylloxeridae. Like aphids, phylloxera feed on the roots, leaves, and shoots of grape plants, but unlike aphids, do not produce honeydew or cornicle secretions. Phylloxera (Daktulosphaira vitifoliae) are insects which caused the Great French Wine Blight that devastated European viticulture in the 19th century. Similarly, adelgids or woolly conifer aphids, also feed on plant phloem and are sometimes described as aphids, but are more properly classified as aphid-like insects, because they have no cauda or cornicles.

Later, a family friend paid for his studies at Westminster School, where the antiquarian, historian, topographer and officer of arms William Camden (1551–1623) was one of his masters. The pupil and master became friends, and the intellectual influence of Camden's broad-ranging scholarship upon Jonson's art and literary style remained notable, until Camden's death in 1623.

text: 一心与总统对着干的辉格党国会不愿影响各州资金分配来提高关税，于1842年6月通过法案分别提升关税且无条件延长分配计划时限。 泰勒认为在必须提升关税应对联邦收入不足之际却继续向各州分配资金实属不智，否决两道法案，与辉格党再无缓和余地。 国会把两道法案合并再度通过，总统仍然否决，国会议员虽然不满，但无法达到推翻否决所需绝对多数。 收入问题必须通过措施缓解，众议院筹款委员会主席米勒德·菲尔莫尔为首的辉格党议员以一票优势在两院通过法案，把关税恢复到1832年水平并中止分配计划。
premise: The defiant Whig Congress would not raise tariffs in a way that would affect the distribution of funds to states. In June 1842 they passed two bills that would raise tariffs and unconditionally extend the distribution program. Believing it improper to continue distribution at a time when federal revenue shortage necessitated increasing the tariff, Tyler vetoed both bills, burning any remaining bridges between himself and the Whigs. Congress tried again, combining the two into one bill; Tyler vetoed it again, to the dismay of many in Congress, who nevertheless failed to override the veto. As some action was necessary, Whigs in Congress, led by the House Ways and Means chairman Millard Fillmore, passed in each house (by one vote) a bill restoring tariffs to 1832 levels and ending the distribution program. Tyler signed the Tariff of 1842 on August 30, pocket vetoing a separate bill to restore distribution.

annotations.comment:
EN: "The defiant Whig Congress"; CN: "The Whig Party Congress, its heart set against the President..." - We know that the controversy here is between the Congress and Tyler, the president (we know he is the president, even if we have not heard of him before, because only the president has the power of the veto, which Tyler is described as using in the English). 

EN: "The...Whig Congress...would not raise tariffs in a way that would affect the distribution of funds to states"; CN: "The...Whig...Congress...was unwilling to affect the states' respective distribution of funds by raising tariffs." (The sentences communicate virtually the same idea; the order of the two main elements (affect and rise) is merely reversed. 

The Chinese makes it clear that the bills "respectively" (分別) "would raise tariffs" and "extend the distribution program"

The sense of "extend" that is used in the Chinese is that of time: 时限 means "the time limit" or "the time range"

The Chinese contains the term "应对," which means "to contend with/in the face of/to deal with"; this term's reference is inferable: the increased tariffs were intended to "deal with" the "federal revenue shortage."

之际 means "the fact of" or "the reality of"; this is just a syntactic add-on. 

“burning any remaining bridges" is accounted for rather elegantly by "再无缓和余地"; this will be readily understood in the context by a reader who has already gone through the English text.

The Chinese refers to the Congress' next attempt as a second "passing" (通过) of the bill; "they passed the bill again." The English merely suggests that they "tried again," but the Chinese expression is inferable. 

The Chinese puts the idea, communicated in the English as "failed to override the veto," in different terms that are just as easily understood: "could not achieve the necessary absolute majority to overturn the veto" (无法...多数).

EN: "As some action was necessary"; CN: "The revenue problem/question required a solution through [some] measure" -- this is eminently inferable. 

优势 means "advantage"; it is easily understood here.

一心... - determined to go against the president - infered from defiant. 向各州 - for each state - infered from the previous sentence. 再度通过 - passed again, infered from the context, it had to be passed by the congress to be vetoed by the president. 收入问题 - the income problem, infered from the context, money is the problem here.

title: 约翰·泰勒
translation3: The Whig Congress, bent on opposing the president, was unwilling to affect the allocation of funds to states to increase tariffs. In June 1842, it passed a bill to increase tariffs and unconditionally extend the time limit of the allocation plan. Taylor believed that it was unwise to continue allocating funds to the states when tariffs must be raised to cope with federal revenue shortfalls. He vetoed two bills, leaving no room for accommodation with the Whigs. Congress merged the two bills and passed them again, but the president still vetoed them. Although members of Congress were dissatisfied, they could not reach the absolute majority required to overturn the veto. The revenue problem had to be alleviated through measures. Whig congressmen, led by Millard Fillmore, chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee, passed bills in both houses with a one-vote advantage to restore the tariff to the 1832 level and suspend the distribution plan.

text: 2010年3月，蘋果公司开始起诉HTC专利侵权，HTC于同年5月回诉苹果，开启两者之间的訴訟戰。 2011年12月，美国国际贸易委员会裁定HTC部分设备侵犯苹果专利，将禁止某些型号手机在美国销售。 2012年11月，宏達電與蘋果公司發布聯合聲明，解除長達32個月專利訴訟戰，雙方達成和解，將撤銷全球所有專利訴訟糾紛，並簽署為期十年之專利授權契約，範圍涵蓋雙方現有與未來所持有的專利。
premise: In March 2010, Apple Inc. filed a complaint with the US International Trade Commission claiming infringement of 20 of its patents covering aspects of the iPhone user interface and hardware. HTC disagreed with Apple's actions and reiterated its commitment to creating innovative smartphones. HTC also filed a complaint against Apple for infringing on five of its patents and sought to ban the import of Apple products into the US from manufacturing facilities in Asia.

annotations.comment:

This is eminently inferable from the English copy; the second sentence, which describes HTC's dispute of Apple's claim of patent infringement, makes it clear that the defendant in Apple's suit is HTC. 

Technically "filed a complaint" (which the English has) could be construed as different from "file suit," which is the phrasing used in the Chinese. And since we cannot determine with certainty that a complaint filed with the US International Trade Commission is necessarily a lawsuit, we must declare that "file suit," as it appears in the Chinese, represents new information. Moreover, although we know that HTC returned in kind, filing a complaint against Apple for patent infringement, we cannot be certain that this action manifested as a countersuit (回诉). So, this term must be "new information," too. 

The English does not provide enough evidence to support the claim in the Chinese that these two complaints constituted the opening salvo of a protracted "lawsuit war" between HTC and Apple. The Chinese continues to describe the "32-month" battle that unfolded, as well as its resolution--none of which is described in the English.

premise: Peas are annual plants, with a life cycle of one year. They are a cool-season crop grown in many parts of the world; planting can take place from winter to early summer depending on location. The average pea weighs between 0.1 and 0.36 gram. The immature peas (and in snow peas the tender pod as well) are used as a vegetable, fresh, frozen or canned; varieties of the species typically called field peas are grown to produce dry peas like the split pea shelled from a matured pod. These are the basis of pease porridge and pea soup, staples of medieval cuisine; in Europe, consuming fresh immature green peas was an innovation of early modern cuisine.

title: 豌豆
translation3: Peas can grow in barren land and like cool and humid climates. It is suitable for spring sowing around mid-February and autumn sowing around mid-October. Before sowing, the seeds need to be soaked in cold water. Applying nitrogen fertilizer is beneficial to the growth of stems and leaves and promotes luxuriant pea seedlings. Watering is especially needed when pods are formed. premise: The Second Council of Lyon was convened on 7 May 1274, to regulate the election of the pope. This Council decreed that the cardinal electors must meet within ten days of the pope's death, and that they must remain in seclusion until a pope has been elected; this was prompted by the three-year sede vacante following the death of Clement IV in 1268. By the mid-16th century, the electoral process had evolved into its present form, allowing for variation in the time between the death of the pope and the meeting of the cardinal electors. Traditionally, the vote was conducted by acclamation, by selection (by committee), or by plenary vote. Acclamation was the simplest procedure, consisting entirely of a voice vote.

Notably, the implications given from this information, in the English and Chinese respectively, are not contradictory on their face.

translation3: The pope is elected by a secret meeting of cardinals. Once elected, he has a lifelong term, but he can resign midway. text: Office最初是一个推广名称，出现于1990年代早期，指一些以前曾单独发售的软件的合集。 「专业版」包含Microsoft Access，Microsoft Outlook 当时不存在。 随着时间的改變，Office应用程序逐渐整合，共享特性，例如：拼写和语法检查、OLE数据整合和VBA脚本语言。 微软目前将Office延伸作为一个开发平台，可以藉由專用商店下載第三方軟體搭配使用。
premise: Microsoft Office, or simply Office, is a discontinued family of client software, server software, and services developed by Microsoft. It was first announced by Bill Gates on August 1, 1988, at COMDEX in Las Vegas. Initially a marketing term for an office suite (bundled set of productivity applications), the first version of Office contained Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel, and Microsoft PowerPoint. Office applications have grown substantially closer with shared features such as a common spell checker, Object Linking and Embedding data integration and Visual Basic for Applications scripting language. Office as a development platform for line-of-business software under the Office Business Applications brand.

annotations.comment:
While the English describes the "office suite" as a "bundled set of productivity applications," the Chinese makes an addition: "a compilation of software (applications) that previously were once sold/marketed individually." This is arguably inferable, but it's a bit of a stretch. We might assume that to bundle a set of productivity applications, they would have to first already exist. We might take a further step, suggesting that these applications might already have been on the market as a stand-alone product or service. While there is a logic to this sequence of reasoning, there simply is not enough information given in the English to call the claim in the Chinese--specifically, that the contents of the suite were "once sold/marketed individually" (以前曾单独发售)--inferable. 

"Application" may be basically synonymous (in this context) with "software" (软件), but as far as I'm concerned, not all software are "applications." The fact that the Chinese entry uses "software," and not one of the several terms that more precisely mean "application" (for instance, 应用程序, literally, 'application program,' which appears two sentences later) is suggestive of a very slight discrepancy here with the English. So, 软件 (software) is inferable. 

The Chinese lends some context to the assertion in the English that "Office applications have grown substantially closer," by adding: "With changes over time..." (随着时间的改变). The Chinese also adds "gradually" (逐渐). 

The idea of "closeness" (整合) and "shared" (共享) are presented as two separate, but related phenomena in the Chinese, while in the English, the "shared" idea is presented as part of the overall "closeness" of the suite's software, which has increased "substantially" over time. 

EN: "a common spell checker"; CN: "spelling and grammar (语法) checking." 

"Object Linking and Embedding" is represented in the Chinese as the initials "OLE." The same goes for "Visual Basic for Applications" (VBA). 

Context, which is missing from the English, about Office's status as "a development platform" is given; and the idea of a "development platform" is expanded upon in the Chinese in a slightly different way than it is in the English.

text: 大多數的鶴臉部都有裸露的皮膚（藍鶴與簑羽鶴則無），據信這能作為與其他同類溝通的一種工具，透過臉部肌肉的收縮傳達訊息。 同樣也可能具有溝通的方式，藍鶴、簑羽鶴與肉垂鶴能將頭部某個特定部分的羽毛豎起或進行移動，被認為可能是訊息傳遞的一種方式。
premise: Most species of cranes have some areas of bare skin on their faces; the only two exceptions are the blue and demoiselle cranes. This skin is used in communication with other cranes, and can be expanded by contracting and relaxing muscles, and change the intensity of colour. Feathers on the head can be moved and erected in the blue, wattled, and demoiselle cranes for signaling, as well.

annotations.comment:
The Chinese does not refer to "species" of crane explicitly; the passage begins: "Most cranes have on their head exposed skin... (blue and demoiselle cranes, however, do not)." Thus, the Chinese references particular species of cranes by name, indicating that the earlier claim concerns species of cranes, as opposed to the crane population more generally (although that may actually be the case).

The Chinese qualifies the claim made in both passages about the function of this bare skin; the English poses (albeit implicitly) this function as a matter of scientific fact, while the Chinese adds: "according to belief/it is believed that" (據信).

text: 骨關節炎（Osteoarthritis，縮寫：OA），或稱退化性關節炎，是一種或關節下骨頭損傷的關節炎，常見症狀是關節疼痛或僵硬，初次發病常僅見於運動之後但發病次數會隨時間增加；其他症狀包含、降低，若進犯背部，則可能導致四肢無力或麻木。 骨關節炎常好發於特定一側，另一側則較少發生；常常會延續多年 ，可能會影響到日常生活或工作，骨關節炎與其他關節炎不同，僅會侵犯關節，而不會進犯其他組織。
premise: Osteoarthritis (OA) is a type of degenerative joint disease that results from breakdown of joint cartilage and underlying bone which affects 1 in 7 adults in the United States. It is believed to be the fourth leading cause of disability in the world. The most common symptoms are joint pain and stiffness. Usually the symptoms progress slowly over years. Other symptoms may include joint swelling, decreased range of motion, and, when the back is affected, weakness or numbness of the arms and legs. The most commonly involved joints are the two near the ends of the fingers and the joint at the base of the thumbs, the knee and hip joints, and the joints of the neck and lower back. The symptoms can interfere with work and normal daily activities. Unlike some other types of arthritis, only the joints, not internal organs, are affected.

annotations.comment:
Although the alternative Chinese name (退化性关节炎) means "degenerative joint inflammation," and despite the fact that the English informs us that OA "is a type of degenerative joint disease," we cannot know from the English that OA can itself BE CALLED "degenerative joint disease/inflammation." Therefore, I am marking this as "new information."

"Joint cartilage" is missing from the Chinese, which says, literally: "is a type of joint inflammation of or underlying bone beneath the joints."

The male has a pair of clasping organs attached to a ring structure, and during copulation, a tubular structure is extruded and inserted into the female's vagina. A spermatophore is deposited in the female, following which the sperm make their way to a seminal receptacle where they are stored for later use. In both sexes, the genitalia are adorned with various spines, teeth, scales and bristles, which act to prevent the butterfly from mating with an insect of another species. A newly emerged butterfly needs to spend some time inflating its wings with hemolymph and letting them dry, during which time it is extremely vulnerable to predators.

text: 1980年，（）的一名24岁的程序员（）花费了四个月时间编写出了 86-DOS 操作系统。 1981年7月，微软以五萬美元的代價向西雅图公司购得本產品的全部版权，并将它更名为 MS-DOS。 腦产品公司的 86-DOS 1.14，但微软很快改进了 MS-DOS，并使它成功地成为 IBM PC 采用的操作系统。 并于1981年8月12日，正式发布 MS-DOS 1.0 和 PC-DOS 1.0。
premise: MS-DOS was a renamed form of 86-DOS owned by Seattle Computer Products, written by Tim Paterson. Development of 86-DOS took only six weeks, as it was basically a clone of Digital Research's CP/M (for 8080/Z80 processors), ported to run on 8086 processors and with two notable differences compared to CP/M: an improved disk sector buffering logic, and the introduction of FAT12 instead of the CP/M filesystem. This first version was shipped in August 1980. Microsoft, which needed an operating system for the IBM Personal Computer, hired Tim Paterson in May 1981 and bought 86-DOS 1.10 for in July of the same year. Microsoft kept the version number, but renamed it MS-DOS. They also licensed MS-DOS 1.10/1.14 to IBM, which, in August 1981, offered it as PC DOS 1.0 as one of three operating systems for the IBM 5150 or the IBM PC.

annotations.comment:
EN: "...in May 1981...in July of the same year"; CN: "In July 1981..."

EN: "Seattle Computer Products"; CN: "[The/A] Seattle company" (西雅图公司), alternatively, "the Seattle company"

We assume that Microsoft acquired "all of the rights" of 86-DOS 1.10, as the Chinese suggests (全部版权), because we know from the English that Microsoft "bought" the operating system, we assume without conditions or caveats. 

EN: "Microsoft...also licensed MS-DOS 1.10/1.13 to IBM"; CN: "Microsoft...made [MS-DOS] successfully become the operating system used by IBM PCs" -- this is inferable, but it was not the only OS used by IBM (there were two others, as the English tells us).

There is no clear subject in the final sentence of the Chinese, but the contents are either inferable or explicitly backed up by the English-language copy. "Formally released" (正式发布) is perhaps the most tenuous claim; we only know that PC DOS 1.0 was "offered" during that month (evidently for the first time).

text: 根據以對哈努曼的研究而聞名的美國學者菲利普·魯根多夫（Philip Lutgendorf）的說法，在伊斯蘭統治到達印度次大陸之後，出現了對哈努曼的崇拜。
premise: According to Philip Lutgendorf, devotionalism to Hanuman and his theological significance emerged long after the composition of the Ramayana, in the 2nd millennium CE. His prominence grew after the arrival of Islamic rule in the Indian subcontinent. He is viewed as the ideal combination of shakti ("strength, heroic initiative and assertive excellence") and bhakti ("loving, emotional devotion to his personal god Rama"). Beyond wrestlers, he has been the patron god of other martial arts. He is stated to be a gifted grammarian, meditating yogi and diligent scholar. He exemplifies the human excellences of temperance, faith and service to a cause.

annotations.comment:
The Chinese describes Lutgendorf as "the American scholar known for his research on Hanuman." Of course, Lutgendorf has done research on Hanuman; otherwise, we would not find him cited in this passage. But, while the claim made in the Chinese that Lutgendorf's notoriety as a scholar stems from his work on Hanuman seems, on its face, convincing, there is not enough information given in the English to support it. However, we can infer from the English that Lutgendorf is a "scholar" (學者), as the Chinese puts it. 

In Chinese, "according to..." (根據) cannot be left on its own; there must be a reference to the thing which is being referenced. So, the Chinese passage contains an "extra" term (說法), which means "opinion," "point of view," "way of putting it," etc. In other words, in Chinese, there is no such thing as the form "according to Lutgendorf, etc." Instead, there is something along the lines of: "According to Lutgendorf's point of view/phrasing/speech/etc."

However, there is a debatable claim put forth in the Chinese, debatable in that it appears to introduce an idea not mentioned in the English. The Chinese reads (beginning from "在"): "after Islamic rule arrived in the Indian subcontinent, there emerged the worship of Hanuman." We know from the English that "devotionalism to Hanuman" emerged "long after" the composition of Ramayana, which occurred between roughly one thousand years ago and as recently as this year (going from the reference to the "2nd millennium CE" alone). Islam "began" about four hundred years before the advent of the second millennium. So, the claim that "devotionalism," which we can pose as being roughly synonymous with "worship" (崇拜) toward Hanuman began after the arrival of Islamic rule in India appears not to be problematic. The question, though, is whether we can assume that the "gr[owth]" of Hanuman's "prominence" can be equated with the emergence of "devotionalism" toward Hanuman. This is arguable, so I am going to mark this segment as "inferable."

text: 促進健康的活動並非針對特定的疾病或身體狀況，而是在一種非常廣泛的層面上促進健康和增進福祉。 另一方面，特定的保護，則是針對一種或一組的疾病，並且用來補充促進，達成健康的目標。
premise: Primary prevention consists of traditional health promotion and "specific protection". Health promotion activities include prevention strategies such as health education and lifestyle medicine, and are current, non-clinical life choices such as eating nutritious meals and exercising often, that prevent lifestyle-related medical conditions, improve the quality of life, and create a sense of overall well-being. Preventing disease and creating overall well-being prolongs life expectancy. Health-promotional activities do not target a specific disease or condition but rather promote health and well-being on a very general level. On the other hand, specific protection targets a type or group of diseases and complements the goals of health promotion.

annotations.comment:
Useful to know: 則 (ze2) is a grammatical particle indicating a contrast or distinction. When paired with "on the other hand" (另一方面) here, it reinforces the distinction being made. Its inclusion does not count, in my opinion, as "new information," because it is a function of the demands of Chinese grammar.
English: "complements the goals of health promotion"; Chinese: "supplements the promotion and the accomplishment of goals [relating to] health.
則 - rather - can be infered from on the other hand. 用來 - being used to - no 補 needed - infered from using specific protection for a type of disease. 達成 - achieving - infered from goals.

title: 預防醫學
translation3: Health-promoting activities do not target a specific disease or condition, but promote health and enhance well-being on a very broad level. Specific protection, on the other hand, targets a disease or a group of diseases and is used to supplement and promote health goals.

text: 生於哈特福，雙親為斯蒂芬與坎蒂·摩根（Stephen and Candy Morgan）。 有五個兄弟姊妹：塞斯（Seth）、艾蜜麗（Emily）、雅各（Jacob）、保羅（Paul）及海蒂（Heidi）。 她就讀於斯科茨代爾的恰帕羅高級中學，而後申請進入普若佛的楊百翰大學並在1995年獲得英國文學文學士學位。 當她在亞歷桑納州長大時，認識了丈夫克里斯強，暱稱「潘丘」，並於1994年結婚，育有三名子女：蓋比（Gabe）、塞斯（Seth）及艾里（Eli）。
premise: Stephenie Morgan was born on December 24, 1973, in Hartford, Connecticut, the second of six children to financial officer Stephen Morgan and Candy Morgan, a homemaker. Meyer was raised in Phoenix, Arizona and attended Chaparral High School in Scottsdale, Arizona. In 1992, Meyer won a National Merit Scholarship, which helped fund her undergraduate studies at Brigham Young University in Provo, Utah, where she received a BA in English Literature in 1997. Although she began and finished her degree at BYU, she took classes at Arizona State University in fall 1996 and spring 1997.

annotations.comment:
The Chinese claims that in 1995 (not 1997, as the English states), Morgan earned a bachelor's of arts degree in "English literature" (as in, British literature), which is not, to my understanding, the same idea as "English literature" as it is used in the American sense (where it refers to English-language literature, including American literature). The Chinese also mentions that she "applied and enrolled in" BYU; had she not applied, she could not have enrolled, so this is inferable. 

The Chinese does mention that Morgan grew up in Arizona, but that information is presented in the context of her meeting her husband, who goes unmentioned in the English.

text: 自2010年以來，民意調查顯示英國人對於是否退出歐盟意見分歧，支持退出一方在2012年11月達到高位，有56%支持退出，只有30%希望留在歐盟，到2015年6月則有43%希望留在歐盟，支持退出的有36%。 至當時為止的最大型的民意調查（2萬人，2014年3月）顯示支持與反對退出歐盟的人數接近，41%支持退出，41%希望留在歐盟，18%未有決定。 不過，當被問到如果英國與歐盟重新議定英國作為歐盟成員國的條件，而英國的利益得到保障時，超過50%的人表示他們會支持英國留在歐盟。
premise: Opinion polls from 2010 onwards suggested the British public were relatively evenly divided on the question, with opposition to EU membership peaking in November 2012 at 56% compared with 30% who prefer to remain in, while in June 2015 those in favour of Britain remaining in the EU reached 43% versus those opposed 36%. The largest ever poll (of 20,000 people, in March 2014) showed the public evenly split on the issue, with 41% in favour of withdrawal, 41% in favour of membership, and 18% undecided. However, when asked how they would vote if Britain renegotiated the terms of its membership of the EU, and the UK Government stated that British interests had been satisfactorily protected, more than 50% indicated that they would vote for Britain to stay in.

annotations.comment:
EN: "opinion polls"; CN: "public opinion polls" (民意调查, literally, "the people's opinion/view/thoughts polls"). I believe that with the group whose opinion was solicited not indicated in the English, the reference made by "opinion polls" can naturally be assumed to be "the public," etc. 

The Chinese begins by stating that the British public held "divergent" views on whether or not to leave the EU. 

The 30% figure is contrasted to the "leave" percentage by the use of "only" (只有). 

EN: "The largest ever poll..."; CN: "The largest-ever public opinion poll up to that point/at that time" (a slight and inferable, but important, difference). 

CN: "and Britain's interest obtained a guarantee/were secured"; EN: "and the UK Government stated that British interests had been satisfactorily protected"

The Chinese paragraph includes a reference to the EU (欧盟) and Britain (英国) that are absent from English; this has to do with syntax and does not represent a significant introduction of new information.
the infered terms are basically just different ways to say the same thing - e.g. 退出 - exit  - infered from "opposition to membership"; 支持 - support - infered from "vote to stay in"

title: 英國去留歐盟公投
translation3: Since 2010, opinion polls have shown that Britons are divided over whether to leave the EU, with pro-exit highs in November 2012, when 56% supported leaving, while only 30% wanted to remain, to 43% by June 2015. % want to stay in the EU, and 36% support exiting. The largest public opinion poll to date (20,000 people, March 2014) showed that the number of people supporting and opposing leaving the EU was close, with 41% supporting leaving, 41% wanting to remain in the EU, and 18% undecided. However, when asked if the UK and the EU renegotiated the terms of UK membership and UK interests were protected, more than 50% said they would support the UK remaining in the EU.

The English begins, "Numismatists have examples of coins from the earliest large-scale societies"; the Chinese starts abruptly, having been excerpted incompletely: "...discovered that multiple early large-scale societies had coins." In either case, if we know from the English that "examples of coins" exist that originate from "the earliest large-scale societies," then we can infer that some "early large-scale societies had coins." There is no contradiction here, except perhaps in the English text's reference to "the earliest," compared to "early," although in this direction (from English to Chinese), there is really no contradiction. Or in "許多" (many, multiple); although the English has "societies," meaning a plurality (許多 can also mean "a plurality," as a means of indicating more than one in a language in which plural and singular are not always obvious.

text: QR碼使用四種標準化編碼模式（數字、字母數字、字節（二進制）和日文（Shift_JIS））來存儲數據。 QR碼常見於日本，為目前日本最通用的二維空間條碼，在世界各國廣泛運用於手機讀碼操作。 碼般在掃描時需要直線對準掃描器，應用範圍包括產品跟踪、物品識別、文檔管理、庫存營銷等等。
premise: A QR code (an initialism for quick response code) is a type of matrix barcode (or two-dimensional barcode) invented in 1994 by Japanese company Denso Wave. A barcode is a machine-readable optical label that can contain information about the item to which it is attached. In practice, QR codes often contain data for a locator, identifier, or tracker that points to a website or application. QR codes use four standardized encoding modes (numeric, alphanumeric, byte/binary, and kanji) to store data efficiently; extensions may also be used.

annotations.comment:
The statement in the Chinese that "QR codes are commonly seen in Japan" may be inferable from the information in the English that the QR code was invented by a Japanese company, but the connection is too tenuous (apart from a mention of the Japanese writing system kanji) to annotate this claim as inferable. At the very most, we know that QR codes were invented in Japan and can support kanji. 

The Chinese states that QR codes are commonly used "for machine reading" of code.

The applications of QR codes listed in the Chinese ("product tracking, object identification, file management, storage, sales, etc.") are inferable (corresponding to: "locator"/"tracker"/, "identifier," "kanji"/"to store data," "to store data," and "points to a website," respectively).
日文 - japanese - infered from kanji. fyi - for the part 碼常見於 - no 碼 is needed. 日本 - japan = japanese in chinese

title: QR碼
translation3: QR codes use four standardized encoding modes (numeric, alphanumeric, byte (binary), and Japanese (Shift_JIS)) to store data. QR codes are common in Japan and are currently the most common two-dimensional barcode in Japan. They are widely used in mobile phone code reading operations in countries around the world. The code needs to be aligned with the scanner in a straight line when scanning. Applications include product tracking, item identification, document management, inventory marketing, etc.

text: 夏天时有较明显的季风，冬天则较无明显的季风，北部高地氣候冬季持續降雪，印度南部的氣候通常比印度北部更熱、更潮濕。 印度气候分为雨季（6–10月）与旱季（3–5月）以及凉季（11–2月），冬天时受喜马拉雅山脉屏障影响，较无寒流或冷高压南下影响印度。
premise: During the post-monsoon or autumn months of October to December, a different monsoon cycle, the northeast (or "retreating") monsoon, brings dry, cool, and dense air masses to large parts of India. Winds spill across the Himalayas and flow to the southwest across the country, resulting in clear, sunny skies. Though the India Meteorological Department (IMD) and other sources refers to this period as a fourth ("post-monsoon") season, other sources designate only three seasons. Depending on location, this period lasts from October to November, after the southwest monsoon has peaked. Less and less precipitation falls, and vegetation begins to dry out. In most parts of India, this period marks the transition from wet to dry seasonal conditions. Average daily maximum temperatures range between in the Southern parts.

annotations.comment:
If we know from the English that the "post-monsoon or autumn months" bring "dry, cool, and dense air masses," then we can infer that the summer months, being the monsoon months (as they come before the "post-monsoon" months), a "different monsoon cycle" occurs, in which wet air moves into the area. This is corroborated later on in the English: "the transition from wet to dry seasonal conditions"; "vegetation begins to dry out," meaning that it had to have been wet to begin with, before the "post-monsoon...months." 

The Chinese phrases the "post-monsoon" "air masses" in an inferable way: "the winter, by contrast, has relatively dry seasonal winds." 

We cannot know from the Chinese that southern India is hotter and more humid than northern India, although this is absolutely the case in reality.

title: 印度氣候
translation3: There is a more obvious monsoon in summer, but less obvious monsoon in winter. The climate in the northern highlands has continuous snowfall in winter. The climate in southern India is generally hotter and more humid than that in northern India. India's climate is divided into rainy season (June-October), dry season (March-May) and cool season (November-February). In winter, it is affected by the barrier of the Himalayas, and there is no cold current or cold high pressure southward to affect India.

text: 《叢林奇譚》由於它的道德成分很高，這本書變成了幼童軍（童軍運動的兒童階段）的啟發性讀物，而其中「吼聲」的各種步驟更仿傚狼群們的開會局面。 伯特·貝登堡向吉卜林請求後取得；而貝登堡原來只是請求吉卜林可否使用《金氏》裡面的〈金氏遊戲〉部分運用在他的計畫，發展成可以提振士氣，並適合城市內工人階級小孩的計畫。
premise: The Jungle Book came to be used as a motivational book by the Cub Scouts, a junior element of the Scouting movement. This use of the book's universe was approved by Kipling at the request of Robert Baden-Powell, founder of the Scouting movement, who had originally asked for the author's permission for the use of the Memory Game from Kim in his scheme to develop the morale and fitness of working-class youths in cities. Akela, the head wolf in The Jungle Book, has become a senior figure in the movement; the name is traditionally adopted by the leader of each Cub Scout pack.

annotations.comment:
It is difficult to argue there is any substantive information in the English that would support the opening claim in the Chinese: "The Jungle Book became motivational reading for the Youth Scouts [Cub Scouts] (the children's stage of the Scouting movement because of [the book's] high moral/ethical content." While it seems natural that a book would not be promoted for young children to read, much less for the sake of "motivating" them, unless it had so-called "high moral content," we are not informed in the English that this was the direct reason for the book's adoption by the Cub Scouts. Going in the other direction, as I will describe in the next paragraph's analysis, an inference can be made. 

The Chinese passage mentions the adoption in scouting ceremonies of certain elements (in particular, the "wolf howl") from the Jungle Book. It also emphasizes Baden-Powell's modest intentions with Kipling's work, by emphasizing that Baden-Powell had originally "merely requested" the use of the "memory game" from Kipling's book Kim. 

"Scheme" is mentioned twice in the Chinese (it is 計畫).

title: 叢林奇譚
translation3: Due to its high moral content, "The Jungle Book" has become an inspiring book for Cub Scouts (the child stage of Scouting), and the various steps of "roaring" in it are more modeled on the meeting situation of a wolf pack. Burt Baden-Powell obtained it after requesting it from Kipling; Baden-Powell originally only asked Kipling if he could use the "King's Game" part of "King's" in his project and develop it into a plan that could boost morale, and a program for working-class kids in the city.

text: 罗伯特·布里奇斯(Robert Bridges)发现了一个悖论：在谋杀邓肯一事上感到颇为恐怖的人，是不太可能去行凶的。 约翰·多佛·威尔逊John Dover Wilson在莎士比亚的原始文献上做出了推论，假设有一些附加场景，丈夫与妻子在其中讨论谋杀计划。 这种由野心驱动的邪恶行为导致他陷入了恶性循环，正如麦克白自己承认的那样：“我已经两足深陷于血泊之中，要是不再涉血前进，那么回头的路也是同样使人厌倦的。”
premise: Yet for other critics, it has not been so easy to resolve the question of Macbeth's motivation. Robert Bridges, for instance, perceived a paradox: a character able to express such convincing horror before Duncan's murder would likely be incapable of committing the crime. For many critics, Macbeth's motivations in the first act appear vague and insufficient. John Dover Wilson hypothesised that Shakespeare's original text had an extra scene or scenes where husband and wife discussed their plans. This interpretation is not fully provable; however, the motivating role of ambition for Macbeth is universally recognised. The evil actions motivated by his ambition seem to trap him in a cycle of increasing evil, as Macbeth himself recognises: "I am in bloodStepp'd in so far that, should I wade no more, Returning were as tedious as go o'er."

annotations.comment:
The Chinese notes that Bridges "realized" or "discovered" a paradox; but this is perfectly understandable in the context given by the English. 

The Chinese describes Macbeth's horror in terms of its degree of intensity ("felt such horror/quite a lot of horror"), while the English describes the horror in terms of its convincingness. The ideas of "express[ing] such convincing horror," as it is put in the English, and that of, "feeling/experiencing such great horror," as it is put in the Chinese, appear to be slightly different. Of course, because we are talking about literature, the character's horror is expressed to the reader, such that the reader can perceive it. It is perhaps to be assumed that Macbeth's "expression" of horror reflects or stems from his genuine horror, that is his genuine sensation of horror, which is what the Chinese addresses. Nonetheless, there is certainly a different verb operating in the Chinese: 感. This verb, meaning "perceive, feel, to move or be moved by," unambiguously relates to Macbeth's psychological state, while "express" unambiguously concerns the outward expression of that psychological state, which the reader might detect and interpret. 

Ultimately both passages deal with the same question: How could a person apparently horrified by the prospect of murder end up carrying out such an act? Therefore, the difference in verbs is basically inconsequential. 

The phrase "committing the crime" in the English corresponds with "去行凶" in the Chinese; I believe that here the term 凶 refers to murder; in the English "the crime" is a direct reference to murder, so there is nothing presented here that constitutes information that one could not not infer from the English.

The Chinese goes an extra step in laying out the background of John Dover Wilson's hypothesis ("made/put forth a corollary/deduction [on the subject of ] Shakespeare's original works"). The Chinese also specifies that the husband and wife "discussed [their] plan to murder" (谋杀计划).

EN: "a cycle of increasing evil"; CN: "a vicious circle"

The Chinese, in translating Macbeth's quote, refers to "a pool of blood" (血泊), which is implied by the original English quotation (especially by the use of "wade"). "So deeply" is used in the Chinese instead of "so far," but because we are talking about a metaphorical "pool," we can assume that the farther one goes into the pool, the deeper the blood becomes. I do not think it is necessary to point out the use of "deeply" (深陷于) in the Chinese. 

The English goes, "...seem to trap him in a cycle," while the Chinese says, "...cause him to become trapped in/to fall into"; there is no substantive difference in meaning here. 

"Tedious" in the English corresponds to "tiresome," "wearisome" in the Chinese (厌倦). The Chinese elaborates on "returning" ("the road back" 回头的路); this mention of "road" (路) is inferable. 

One final note: While the English goes, "would likely be incapable of...," the Chinese has it as: "would not be likely to..." or "would be not be very capable of..." (可能 can refer to capability or ability, and to probability or likelihood). I think the Chinese employs this phrasing to avoid using the term "可能" twice (where "likely" and "incapable" would both involve the use of 可能).

title: 馬克白

John Dover Wilson extrapolated from Shakespeare's original text, supposing there were additional scenes in which the husband and wife discussed plans for the murder. This evil behavior driven by ambition leads him into a vicious circle, as Macbeth himself admits: "I have my feet in the blood, and if I don't go forward in blood, the road back will be equally boring." Tired.”

text: 2007年4月，摩洛哥政府建议一个自治实体通过撒哈拉事务皇家咨询委员会（CORCAS）对西撒哈拉实行一定程度的自治。 摩洛哥提案的僵局导致联合国在2007年4月的一份“联合国秘书长报告”中要求各方进行直接和无条件的谈判，以达成双方都能接受的政治解决方案。
premise: In April 2007, the government of Morocco suggested that a self-governing entity, through the Royal Advisory Council for Saharan Affairs (CORCAS), should govern the territory with some degree of autonomy for Western Sahara. The project was presented to the UN Security Council in mid-April 2007. A stalemate over the Moroccan proposal led the UN, in an April 2007 "Report of the UN Secretary-General", to ask the parties to enter into direct and unconditional negotiations to reach a mutually accepted political solution.

annotations.comment:
The Chinese does not include the second sentence in the English ("The project was presented..."). 

EN: "to reach a mutually accepted"; CN: "to reach an acceptable-to-both-sides" (where 双方都能 is serving as a big noun phrase)

EN: "political solution"; CN: "political solution measure" (this is just because there is no plain word for "solution" in Chinese; 解决 is the closest match, but it can only be an adjective or verb; in the adjectival form, it can only be glossed as "solution-al" or "solution-ary," neither of which is a real word in English).
no annotation needed

title: 撒拉威阿拉伯民主共和國
translation3: In April 2007, the Moroccan government recommended that an autonomous entity exercise a degree of autonomy for Western Sahara through the Royal Consultative Commission on Saharan Affairs (CORCAS). text: 尼歐和崔妮蒂再次連線進入「母體」成功救出莫菲斯，在莫菲斯和崔妮蒂回到真實世界後，尼歐卻被攔截到他的史密斯擊斃而呈现彌留狀態。 此時真實世界中的崔妮蒂緊依著尼歐和他對話並深深的吻了他，感受到真實世界的深情之後尼歐彷彿頓悟一般地復活，復活後的尼歐對自己「救世主」的身份已無絲毫懷疑，明白到自己可以重寫「母體」內程式的能力。 尼歐入侵史密斯的程式碼使他被覆寫刪除，史密斯因此爆炸而灰飛煙滅，其他的特務見狀嚇得落荒而逃，尼歐最後也平安返回現實世界。

premise: May (in Latin, Maius) was named for the Greek goddess Maia, who was identified with the Roman era goddess of fertility, Bona Dea, whose festival was held in May. Conversely, the Roman poet Ovid provides a second etymology, in which he says that the month of May is named for the maiores, Latin for "elders," and that the following month (June) is named for the iuniores, or "young people" (Fasti VI.88).

annotations.comment:
CN: "may originate in the Roman mythology goddess of fecund harvests and fertility, Maia." Maia and Bona Dea are treated as separate possible etymologies for "May" in the Chinese, indicated by the use of "或," meaning "or." The English draws a connection between Maia and Bona Dea by use of "who was identified with."

Because the Chinese passage is describing the etymology of an English word, inevitably it will be necessary to indicate this "double translation" at some points in the passage, such as in the opening phrase ("In English, the fifth month is called May..."), whereas the English entry begins with the assumption that readers know what "May" means already; therefore, the English can immediately introduce the Latin term for May, the fifth month. There is more historical linguistic continuity or relation between English and Latin than there is between Chinese and Latin, although Chinese has in recent centuries absorbed and/or appropriated many Latin terms.

text: 類風溼性關節炎在已開發國家會影響約0.5至1%的成年人，每年十萬人中約有5至50人會罹患此疾病。 類風溼性關節炎從1990年造成28000人死亡，到2013年則造成38000人死亡。 第一個做出關於類風濕性關節炎描述是在1800年的巴黎，由 博士(1772–1840)做出 reproduced in 。 類風溼性關節炎的原文「rheumatoid arthritis」源自希臘文，表示關節的出水與發炎。
premise: RA affects about 24.5 million people as of 2015. This is between 0.5 and 1% of adults in the developed world with between 5 and 50 per 100,000 people newly developing the condition each year. Onset is most frequent during middle age and women are affected 2.5 times as frequently as men. It resulted in 38,000 deaths in 2013, up from 28,000 deaths in 1990. The first recognized description of RA was made in 1800 by Dr. Augustin Jacob Landré-Beauvais (1772–1840) of Paris. The term rheumatoid arthritis is based on the Greek for watery and inflamed joints.

annotations.comment:
The Chinese collapses the first two sentences of the English to an extent: It reads, "Rheumatoid arthritis in 'already'- (已) developed countries affects about 0.5 to 1% of adults..." 

We know, from common sense, that "the developed world" is made up of "developed countries," that is, "countries that are already developed," (已開發國家). This Chinese expression strikes me as rather "non-PRC"-sounding. Indeed, the simplified Chinese Wikipedia article for "developed country" uses the term "发达国家," which can be translated directly as "developed countries." 发达 connotes a sense of maturity, while 開發 (开发 in simplified Chinese) connotes, in my opinion, an idea of "prospecting," "opening-up," or "developing" much in the sense of converting undeveloped land into marketable real estate. The traditional Chinese article uses the term “已開發." 

The sense, conveyed in the English, that between 5 and 50 people per 100,000 develop the condition, representing people "newly" afflicted by rheumatoid arthritis each year, is not as clear in the Chinese (although the Chinese uses the verb phrase 罹患, which means something along the lines of "contract"/"suffer from").

The Chinese paragraph describes the "first description" of RA as occurring in "Paris in 1800"; the name of the describer (Dr. Landré-Beauvais) is missing from the Chinese.

"Rheumatoid arthritis" is described by the English as being the "original term" for the condition, in addition to deriving from Greek.

premise: It typically inhabits deciduous forests, mixed forests and thornbrush forests. In the summer, it usually inhabits altitudes of around in the Himalayas but rarely above . In winter, it descends to altitudes below .

annotations.comment:
EN: "deciduous forests"; CN: "temperate-zone deciduous broadleaf forests"; "needle-broadleaf mixed forests." 

We know from the English that this animal lives at high altitudes ("in the Himalayas"), but we don't know what altitude range specifically. 

It is unclear whether "thornbrush forests" corresponds to "needleleaf forests." I am tempted to say that "thornbrush forests" corresponds more closely to the mention in the Chinese of "subtropical arid river valley scrublands." But because there just isn't enough information to support this hunch solidly, I will not annotate the scrublands mention as inferable. On the other hand, "mixed forests," especially when contrasted to "deciduous forests," refers to forests with both deciduous and evergreen trees; therefore, mentions of "needleleaf forests" in the Chinese are inferable. Scrublands, however, do not conjure an image of "forests"; so that is another reason we should take caution when considering whether "thornbrush forests" corresponds to "scrublands."

The Chinese notes that this animal has a migratory tendency; this can be inferred from the English ("In the summer...; "In winter..."). Moreover, the Chinese notes: "In the summer, it resides high in the mountains/on high mountains"; the English observes: "it usually inhabits altitudes of around in the Himalayas but rarely above," which, despite missing the critical piece of information that is the altitude range, we can conclude safely from the context (altitudes, Himalayas, rarely above) that we are talking about high elevations in the world's highest mountain range, the Himalayas. So, the Chinese statement is inferable. 

The Chinese says of the animal's winter behavior: "prior to the arrival of winter," (compared to "In winter," in the English), "it moves gradually from high elevations to relatively low-altitude areas." This information is mainly inferable (except for "prior to" and "gradually"); but the last portion is not inferable from the English ("even [descending] to arid river valley scrublands").

premise: In 1948, James Brunot, a resident of Newtown, Connecticut, and one of the few owners of the original Criss-Crosswords game, bought the rights to manufacture the game in exchange for granting Butts a royalty on every unit sold. Although he left most of the game (including the distribution of letters) unchanged, Brunot slightly rearranged the "premium" squares of the board and simplified the rules; he also renamed the game Scrabble, a real word which means "to scratch frantically". In 1949, Brunot and his family made sets in a converted former schoolhouse in Dodgingtown, Connecticut, a section of Newtown. They made 2,400 sets that year but lost money. According to legend, Scrabbles big break came in 1952 when Jack Straus, president of Macy's, played the game on vacation. Upon returning from vacation, he was surprised to find that his store did not carry the game. He placed a large order, and within a year, "everyone had to have one".

He put the game on sale at Macy's, a famous department store in New York, and the game became popular.

text: 海明威的處女作《三個故事和十首詩》（1923年）由羅伯特·麥卡蒙（Robert McAlmon）在巴黎出版。 同年，他們一家回到多倫多短暫逗留，就在那時，海明威的第一個兒子出生，取名約翰，並請格楚特斯坦當約翰的教母。 由於要支持整個家庭的開支，海明威逐漸變得忙碌，並開始覺得多倫多星報的工作沉悶，遂於1924年1月1日辭職。 海明威為星報撰寫的作品大多後來大多出版於1985年的《Dateline: Toronto》。
premise: Hemingway was devastated on learning that Hadley had lost a suitcase filled with his manuscripts at the Gare de Lyon as she was traveling to Geneva to meet him in December 1922. In the following September the couple returned to Toronto, where their son John Hadley Nicanor was born on October 10, 1923. During their absence, Hemingway's first book, Three Stories and Ten Poems, was published. Two of the stories it contained were all that remained after the loss of the suitcase, and the third had been written early the previous year in Italy. Within months a second volume, in our time (without capitals), was published. The small volume included six vignettes and a dozen stories Hemingway had written the previous summer during his first visit to Spain, where he discovered the thrill of the corrida. He missed Paris, considered Toronto boring, and wanted to return to the life of a writer, rather than live the life of a journalist.

annotations.comment:
Hemmingway's "first book" is described by the use of an idiomatic expression (處女座), 處女 meaning "maiden," as in "maiden voyage," but literally meaning "virginal girl," which is also the definition of "maiden" in some cases. 

The Hemmingways are described in the Chinese as "staying" in Toronto, which is inferable; they were there for at least ten days. Rather than describe John Hadley Nicanor's birth in terms of its place (Toronto), like the English, the Chinese describes it relative to time ("it was at that time/during that time, that Hemmingway's first son was born," 就在那時，海明威的第一個兒子出生). We do not know from the English, though, that John was Hemmingway's "first son," as the Chinese suggests (第一個兒子); but we can assume that he was "Hemmingway's...son" from the English ("their son"). 

The Chinese describes Hemmingway's feeling that Toronto was "dull" (沈悶) differently from the English; the Chinese notes his perception that his job (工作) for the "Star" newspaper in Toronto was dull.
海明威 - hemingway. infered info - infered from in the following September the couple returned to Toronto, where their son John Hadley Nicanor was born

title: 欧内斯特·海明威
translation3: Hemingway's debut novel, Three Stories and Ten Poems (1923), was published in Paris by Robert McAlmon. In the same year, the family returned to Toronto for a short stay. At that time, Hemingway's first son was born, named John, and asked Gertrude Stein to be John's godmother. As Hemingway had to support the entire family's expenses, Hemingway gradually became busy and began to find his work at the Toronto Star boring, so he resigned on January 1, 1924. Most of Hemingway's works for the Star were later published in Dateline: Toronto in 1985.

text: 几年后，1960年5月开始，他在10频道主持每星期天晚11：30播出的「迈阿密秘密调查」（Miami Undercover）。
premise: King's Miami radio show brought him local attention. A few years later, in May 1960, he hosted Miami Undercover, airing Sunday nights at 11:30 p.m. on WPST-TV Channel 10 (now WPLG).

annotations.comment:
The Chinese unambiguously asserts that King hosted Miami Undercover on a continuing basis, "beginning" (开始) in May of 1960. This is hinted at by the English, which, by noting that "he hosted Miami Underground" in May 1960, seems to suggest that he hosted the show only for the duration of that month, or for a single program. The use of the "-ing" form of "airing" suggests continuity, but it is unclear whether the continuity implied thusly concerns the show itself or King's hosting of it. 

On the other hand, the Chinese highlights the weekly frequency of the program (writing, literally, "Beginning in May 1960, he on Channel 10 hosted the every Sunday at 11:30 PM broadcasting 'Miami Undercover'"--in such a way that also does not seem to extend the continuity of the show to King's hosting of it. Nevertheless, the use of "开始," meaning "to begin," "beginning in," etc., informs us that King did not host the show only in May of 1960, as might be concluded from the English.
开始 - starting - he started in may so it's inferable but not mentioned explicitly

title: 拉里·金
translation3: A few years later, starting in May 1960, he hosted "Miami Undercover" on Channel 10, which aired every Sunday at 11:30 p.m.

text: 虽然功利主义的哲学理论先驱可以追溯到认为幸福是唯一美好的事情的享乐主义者亞里斯提卜和伊比鳩魯，但功利主义的传统开始于杰里米·边沁，相关哲学家有约翰·斯图尔特·密尔、亨利·西季威克、、和彼得·辛格。
premise: Though the seeds of the theory can be found in the hedonists Aristippus and Epicurus, who viewed happiness as the only good, and in the work of the medieval Indian philosopher Śāntideva, the tradition of modern utilitarianism began with Jeremy Bentham, and continued with such philosophers as John Stuart Mill, Henry Sidgwick, R. M. Hare, and Peter Singer. The concept has been applied towards social welfare economics, questions of justice, the crisis of global poverty, the ethics of raising animals for food, and the importance of avoiding existential risks to humanity.

annotations.comment: Stuart Mill, Sidgwick and Singer are described as "related philosophers." Hare is not mentioned; nor is Santideva.

功利主义 - utilitarianism - infered from the latter information. 哲学 - philosophy - infered from the context, it is a philosophy theory. 先驱 - pioneer - infered from those people planting the seed and can therefore be seen as pioneers. 的事情 - kind of thing - infered from the context, happiness is a good thing. 但 - but - infered from the context, there are people who planted the seed, BUT the following people are people who developed this theory.

title: 功利主義
translation3: Although the philosophical precursors of utilitarianism can be traced back to the hedonists Aristippus and Epicurus, who believed that happiness was the only good thing, the utilitarian tradition began with Jeremy Bentham and related philosophers such as John Stuart Mill, Henry Sidgwick, and Peter Singer.
